intro: Pterocyclus rotundatus, commonly known as the round-leaved pterocyclus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its rounded, succulent leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it may be considered invasive in certain areas.
